ttl.name: REAR NO. 1 SEAT ASSEMBLY (for Captain Seat Type)

atten2.ptxt: Wear protective gloves. Sharp areas on the parts may injure your hands.

item.ptxt: Use the same procedure for the RH and LH sides.
The procedure listed below is for the RH side.

s2.ptxt: Remove the rear seat headrest assembly.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE REAR SEAT INNER CUSHION SHIELD RH

s2.ptxt: Remove the 2 screws.
Detach the rear part of the rear seat inner cushion shield RH in the order shown in the illustration, and then detach the claw and remove the rear seat inner cushion shield RH.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE REAR NO. 1 SEAT INNER BELT ASSEMBLY RH

s2.ptxt: Remove the nut and rear No. 1 seat inner belt assembly RH.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE RECLINING ADJUSTER RELEASE HANDLE RH

s2.ptxt: Raise the reclining adjuster release handle RH to reveal the claw. Using a screwdriver, detach the claw and remove the reclining adjuster release handle RH.

atten4.ptxt: Tape the screwdriver tip before use.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE REAR SEAT CUSHION SHIELD RH

s2.ptxt: Remove the 2 screws.
Detach the rear part of the rear seat cushion shield RH in the order shown in the illustration, and then detach the claw and remove the rear seat cushion shield RH.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE REAR SEAT ARMREST ASSEMBLY RH

s2.ptxt: Detach the fastener and open the rear seat armrest cover.
Remove the bolt, armrest lock plate, No. 1 armrest plate and rear seat armrest assembly RH from the rear No. 1 seatback frame.
Remove the center seat hinge spacer from the rear seat armrest assembly RH.
Using needle nose pliers, remove the seatback spring.
Remove the 4 bolts and rear No. 1 seatback assembly from the rear No. 1 seat cushion assembly.
Detach the 2 hooks and roll up the rear No. 1 seatback cover.
Remove the hog rings from the wires of the rear No. 1 seatback cover. Then roll up the rear No. 1 seatback cover.
Remove the hog rings and detach the 2 straps of the rear No. 1 seatback cover.
Pass the 2 straps of the rear No. 1 seatback cover through the 2 holes of the No. 1 seatback pad RH to the surface.
Roll up the rear No. 1 seatback cover to detach the 2 hooks.
Remove the hog rings from the center of the No. 1 seatback pad and roll up the rear No. 1 seatback cover.
Remove the hog rings from the upper part of the rear No. 1 seatback frame. Then roll up the rear No. 1 seatback cover.
Detach the 4 claws and remove the 2 rear seat headrest supports.
Remove the hog rings and rear No. 1 seatback cover from the No. 1 seatback pad RH.
Remove the No. 1 seatback pad RH from the rear No. 1 seatback frame.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE REAR SEAT CUSHION EDGE PROTECTOR

s2.ptxt: Bend out the 2 cushion edge tabs.

atten3.ptxt: Be careful not to break the cushion edge tabs.

s2.ptxt: Remove the 2 rear seat cushion edge protectors from the 2 cushion edge tabs.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE SEAT CUSHION COVER WITH PAD

entry.ptxt: Rear No. 1 Seat Cushion Cover Lower Part

s2.ptxt: Detach the hook.
Remove the hog rings and fold back the lower part of the rear No. 1 seat cushion cover.
Remove the hog rings and the seat cushion cover with pad from the rear No. 1 seat cushion frame.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE REAR NO. 1 SEAT CUSHION COVER

s2.ptxt: Remove the hog rings and rear No. 1 seat cushion cover from the rear No. 1 seat cushion pad.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE REAR SEAT CUSHION EDGE PROTECTOR RH

s2.ptxt: Remove the rear seat cushion edge protector RH from the reclining adjuster lower arm sub-assembly RH.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE NO. 1 SEAT CUSHION FRAME SUB-ASSEMBLY RH

s2.ptxt: Remove the 4 bolts and No. 1 seat cushion frame sub-assembly RH.
Using a screwdriver, detach the 2 springs and remove the seat track adjusting handle as shown in the illustration.

atten4.ptxt: The seat track adjusting handle will get caught on the springs when removing it. Detach the springs to remove the seat track adjusting handle.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE RECLINING ADJUSTER LOWER ARM SUB-ASSEMBLY LH

s2.ptxt: Remove the 3 bolts and reclining adjuster lower arm sub-assembly LH from the rear seat inner track assembly RH.

s-1.ptxt: REMOVE RECLINING ADJUSTER LOWER ARM SUB-ASSEMBLY RH

atten4.ptxt: Use the same procedure described for the LH side.
